Final project for the Software Security course: vulnerability analysis and exploitation of the OWASP NodeGoat application, including static code analysis, attack simulation (XSS, CSRF, Session Hijacking, Server-Side JS Injection), and mitigation techniques.

A collection of detailed, hands-on write-ups for Hack The Box (HTB) machines that I‚Äôve rooted. Each write-up is a real-world walkthrough of how I approached, enumerated, exploited, and escalated privileges on vulnerable boxes.

This project implements a complete Evil Twin attack targeting WPA2-Enterprise (Eduroam) networks by exploiting clients that do not validate RADIUS certificates. It automates rogue AP deployment (hostapd-wpe), DNS/DHCP spoofing (dnsmasq), captive portal delivery (Flask), HTTPS interception (mitmproxy), and MS-CHAPv2 hash capture and cracking ‚Äî built

Windows log analysis lab from Hack The Box Academy. Investigated system compromise through deep analysis of Security, System, and Application logs. Identified privilege escalation, service creation, and lateral movement using Event Viewer and PowerShell. Extracted IOCs and mapped findings to MITRE ATT&amp;CK techniques.

This is a Python-based exploit for **CVE-2025-49493**, which affects Akamai CloudTest versions before 60 2025.06.02 (12988). The vulnerability allows for XML External Entity (XXE) injection through the SOAP service endpoint.

My approach for this project was to focus on dependency inversion, single responsibility, and loose coupling principles. The dependency injection pattern ensure future updates can be made modularly.

The Linux Hardening Audit Tool is a Python-based CLI utility that automates security audits on Linux systems. Based on CIS Benchmarks, it checks firewall, SSH, file permissions, password policies, and more‚Äîdelivering scored, color-coded reports for easy risk assessment.

Script that automates the process of escalating privileges on openbsd system (CVE-2019-19520)  by exploiting the xlock binary and againing it's sgid and escalating to the root user by (CVE-2019-19522) exploiting the privileges of auth group and adding keys to the Skey or Yubikey
Escalation of Privilege to the root through sudo binary with chroot option. CVE-2025-32463

Malicious-ONNX is a proof-of-concept (PoC) demonstrating how ONNX model files can be weaponized using metadata-based payload injection. The attack leverages the metadata_props field to embed an obfuscated Python-based script, enabling remote code execution (RCE) and data exfiltration upon model loading.
Linear Regression project to predict yearly customer spending on an e-commerce platform using behavior metrics like session length and time on app.

Proof of Concept for CVE-2025-24813, a Remote Code Execution vulnerability in Apache Tomcat. This PoC exploits unsafe deserialization via crafted session files uploaded through HTTP PUT requests, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely on vulnerable Tomcat servers.

Launched a Directory Traversal attack against a vulnerable FTP server to access restricted files, and used Wireshark to identify unauthorized file access and uncover hidden reports.

This repository contains my beginner-friendly walkthrough of Linux privilege escalation techniques using a virtual lab setup. I explored how to escalate from a normal user to root by exploiting misconfigurations like SUID binaries, sudo permissions, and writable system files. All steps are documented for learning and practice purposes.

scanWAS detects network devices using fping and simulates ARP spoofing with arpspoof to assess security risks. It helps identify vulnerabilities and strengthen defenses against MITM attacks.  ‚ö† Warning: Use only with authorization for ethical security testing.
Buffer overflow and memory corruption exploit exercises from the Protostar wargame. Analyzing, crafting payloads, and demonstrating step-by-step exploitation techniques using GDB and Python.

XML External Entity Injection (XXE) is a critical web application vulnerability that arises due to insecure XML parsing. Attackers can exploit this flaw to access sensitive data, perform SSRF attacks, or even execute remote code, depending on the application's configuration and environment.

This cheatsheet contains techniques, commands, and tools commonly used during penetration tests. It covers various stages of penetration testing, including enumeration, exploitation, lateral movement, privilege escalation, and post-exploitation.
A lightweight Python-based tool that scans websites for common security vulnerabilities including SQL Injection, XSS, directory traversal, open redirects, missing HTTP headers, and weak login forms.

This script automates the exploitation of the BadSuccessor vulnerability, and can be executed from a Windows host that is not domain-joined. BadSuccessor allows domain accounts with the ability to create gMSA accounts to perform privilege escalation, providing access to the password hash of any domain account (including DA accounts).

A high-performance, concurrent DOM-based Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability scanner written in Go. This tool analyzes web pages for potential DOM XSS vulnerabilities by examining inline JavaScript, event handlers, and dangerous patterns that could lead to client-side code execution.

This repository contains a Proof of Concept (PoC) exploit for the **CVE-2025-47175** vulnerability found in Microsoft PowerPoint.   The vulnerability is a Use-After-Free (UAF) bug that allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code by tricking a user into opening a specially crafted PPTX file.

The `offsec-bash` directory contains Bash scripts used for enumeration, exploitation, privilege escalation, and system administration in Unix/Linux environments.

Repository containing writeups of CTF machines from platforms like HackTheBox, HackMyVM, and VulNyx. It includes detailed steps for exploiting vulnerabilities, privilege escalation, and post-exploitation.
